intro: Burmannia stuebelii, commonly known as the golden burmannia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Burmannia stuebelii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique floral display.
